title: How to Make Irish Brown Bread

steps.headline: In a bowl, mix the all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
steps.description: With a pastry blender or 2 knives, cut in the butter until this mixture forms fine crumbs. Stir in whole-wheat flour and oats.

steps.headline: Add in the yogurt and stir gently.
steps.description: If the mixture is too dry to hold together, stir in some milk, one teaspoon at a time, just until the dough holds together. It should not be sticky.

steps.headline: Turn the dough onto a lightly-floured board and knead gently 5 times to make a ball.
Set onto a lightly-greased baking sheet.
With a floured knife, cut a large X on the top.
Bake in a 375-degree oven until well-browned, or about 40 minutes.
steps.description: Cool to your liking on a rack. Serve warm or cold, with or without butter.

text: In a bowl, mix the all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. With a pastry blender or 2 knives, cut in the butter until this mixture forms fine crumbs. Stir in whole-wheat flour and oats. Add in the yogurt and stir gently. If the mixture is too dry to hold together, stir in some milk, one teaspoon at a time, just until the dough holds together. It should not be sticky. Turn the dough onto a lightly-floured board and knead gently 5 times to make a ball.  Set onto a lightly-greased baking sheet.  Pat it into a 7-inch circle.  With a floured knife, cut a large X on the top.  Bake in a 375-degree oven until well-browned, or about 40 minutes. Cool to your liking on a rack. Serve warm or cold, with or without butter.
